result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M. Grabowska

Grabowska in court with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson. Attorney Thorson states he has not received and offer yet and requests a new return date.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Grabowska not in court, in custody in Eau Claire County jail.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Anthony M. Grabowska. Attorney Thorson states he requested that the defendant not be brought over. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/26/2022 at 3:00 PM

10:00 AM cases 22CF810, 22CF907, 22CF913, 22CF960, 22CM464 called. Defendant Anthony M. Grabowska in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. All files are re scheduled for 9/7/22 at 9:30 AM.
